newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Deson Dev seen aiming for June HK listing - sources.
newsitem.headline: Deson Dev seen aiming for June HK listing - sources.

text.p: Contractor and property investor Deson Development International Holdings Ltd is planning to raise HK$60-70 million by floating 25 percent of the company in Hong Kong in early June, market sources said.
"Application for the new shares is expected to start next week with trading on the shares seen starting in early June," a source said.

Hong Kong-based Deson Development is mainly engaged as a contractor in the construction business in China and is also involved in property investment. It has three representative offices in China's Shanghai, Hangzhou and Fuzhou.
"The profit-margin of their China contracting business is between 15 and 20 percent," an analyst quoted the company as saying in a presentation on Friday.
Deson Development said it posted a net profit of HK$26.87 million for the year ended March 31, 1996 on turnover of HK$422.95 million.
This compared with HK$31.52 million profit on turnover of HK$308.68 million for fiscal 1994/95.
In the nine months ended December 31, 1996, its net profit surged to HK$39.99 million on turnover of HK$301.83 million.

The group has outstanding projects on hand with an aggregate contract value amounting to about HK$1.344 billion in China and its property investments as at March 31, 1997 were valued at about HK$164.5 million.
These investments currently generate an annual rental income of about HK$8.3 million, the company told analysts.
